intro: Fagara adolfi-friederici, commonly known as the Adolph-Friederici soursop, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the mango and cashew. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture with a distinctive scent. The fruit is a spiny, green berry that turns yellow when ripe, and it contains a single large seed.
